attributes.action: To listen to the people and to trigger the article 50 so we can Brexit.
attributes.background: The people of England have spoken we need the article 50 to be triggered. We have voted for this country to be out of the EU.Therefore the government should listen to its people.
attributes.additional_details: We joined the EU for trading only NOT to be under their laws as suggested. We want democracy not to be the EU's puppets.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for street lights to utilize motion sensors to turn them on.
attributes.background: I believe that there is no need for street lights to be turned on when they are not in use. This is a waste of energy. My solution for this is to make it mandatory for street lights to incorporate motion sensors to activate them, therefore will only be turned on when they will be utilized.

attributes.action: Urge Broadband Companies to change old aluminium wires to copper for fibre optic
attributes.background: I have an old aluminium line that goes a fair distance which causes a lot of drop off in the connection, as aluminium is a worse conductor in comparison to copper. Households across England get offered broadband packages that connection lines cannot deliver due to old forgotten aluminium cables.
attributes.additional_details: I live in Milton Keynes, in an area called two mile ash where aluminium is used, I am fairly far away from the cabinet I’m connected to which causes me to get a max connection of 10.5Mbps download and 1Mbps upload. Houses further than me experience a worse drop off rate however an area near me called Emerson valley, where they've used copper can reach speeds of 54Mbps download and 13Mbps upload copper makes a big difference and should be the standard for a modern faster England.

attributes.action: Penalties for those who park in parent-toddler spaces without children
attributes.background: As a father of two children and a driver, I find it hugely ignorant of those who find it acceptable to park in parent-toddler spaces when they do not have children. There are penalities for parking in a disabled space incorrectly so why not the same for parent-toddler spaces?

attributes.action: Fully fund A&E and urgent care by a specific A&E tax paid by most people.
attributes.background: There is national alarm at the state of many A and E departments with excessive waiting times and some inappropriate use by people who should be treated elsewhere. Separate funding paid for fully by a broad based tax to which most if not all contribute is needed to provide sufficient urgent care.
attributes.additional_details:
Refer to sensible views of Philippa Whitford in the NHS and Social Care funding in the House of Commons on Jan 11th 2017. She presents the impressive model as practised in Scotland.
Everyone knows that A and E is not coping in many parts of the country. This is exacerbated by the lack of GP availability out of hours and at weekends. Demand has risen due to an ageing population and lack of alternative facilities. A and E is one of the few services that virtually everybody will use in their lives.

attributes.action: Nominate Tunstall Tower Square as a UNESCO World Heritage Site
attributes.background: Tunstall Tower Square in Stoke on Trent is an indicative example of Tower squares across the country. In an area of high cultural significance for the country and for the industrial revolution which changed the world forever the Tower Square should be protected.

attributes.action: To make a ban on eating disorder websites or videos as this destroys lives.
attributes.background: This is something that effects me. I think that promoting the way doing eating disorders is disgusting and should be a crime as it affects lives. I have seen all these websites where they tell best was to purge (throwing up food). This is horrible and needs to stop as this is killing people.
attributes.additional_details: The are many horrible web sites like these that need to be banned as they are destroying lives and families. Please help me stop these horrible websites as they are messing peoples lives.

attributes.action: A standard internet speed of 24 megabits per second (Mbps) for the UK.
attributes.background: In the 21st Century our lives are dependent on the internet; while in Dorset, Eng we have to depend on 0.64 Mbps download. This is humiliatingly far behind other nations' and insufficient to even stream a film. Therefore, we propose a minimum speed of 24 Mbps that will ensure fair speeds for the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Here are some examples of the poor speeds from across the UK:

http://www.bbc.co.uk/newsbeat/article/38067272/autumn-statement-five-places-you-say-need-better-broadband-around-the-uk

In rural Dorset: http://www.speedtest.net/my-result/5904028990

http://www.techdigest.tv/2016/12/4g-coverage-better-in-peru-than-britain-says-damning-report-from-lord-adonis.html

http://www.telecomstechnews.com/news/2016/dec/20/uk-14-million-premises-lack-decent-broadband-connections-finds-ofcom/

attributes.action: The Government should recognise Taiwan's right for national self determination.
attributes.background: The UK Government should revise its view of the 'One China Policy' to recognize that Taiwan is a beacon of democracy in Asia and that it is for the people of Taiwan to decide their future and not the Chinese Communist Party, which is known to be an authoritarian and oppressive government.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is not about requesting that the UK Government recognises Taiwan as a country but instead that it recognises that it is for the people of Taiwan to determine their future free of threats from the Chinese Government.

The Chinese Government's claim to control the destiny of the people Taiwan is a dangerous and outdated philosophy based on colonialism. This is because although Taiwan was once part of mainland China it has not been for almost a 120 years.

attributes.action: Amend the Trade Union Act 2016 to remove trade union immunity from damages.
attributes.background: RMT & ASLEF have been striking for no discernible aim other than to cause harm to the commuters that use Southern Rail. They have wreaked untold costs upon individuals, families & businesses, yet they have legal immunity from the laws that govern every other person & organisation in the country.
attributes.additional_details:
This advantage that gives unions legal immunity from any claims for damages arising from their behaviour, however destructive, is wrong. Even the government has been taken to court by an individual before being allowed to invoke article 50, yet someone that loses their job because of persistent union action has no recourse to the courts, it is unjust and unfair. 

Unjustifiable strikes must stop, unfair advantages must stop.
 
Please help to get the Trade Union Act 2016 amended and remove the unfair trade union immunity from damages.

attributes.action: Give HMRC more funding to help stamp out tax evasion.
attributes.background: Tax fraud costs the government  £16bn every year. HMRC are making cuts to "save money" in reality these job losses are hurting the economy. Tax avoidance is hurting services like the NHS and is leading to low earning citizens having to pay higher taxes. Sign to make the government give more funding.

attributes.action: Stop Network Rail removing lineside trees for their own commercial gain.
attributes.background: Recently a residential area within Stirling received generic letters for Network Rail advising that from 26th November 2016 they were going to be removing trees and plants from their lineside. They advised this was to minimise the risk of disrupting railway operations.
attributes.additional_details: This proposed action is completely unjustified and un-proportionate. They have not considered the impact on the environment, wildlife and the effect it will have for local residents. The letter states that they will be removing trees,plants and vegetation unto 10 meters from their lineside, this will in effect create a concrete jungle and damage the beautiful aesthetics of Stirling. This must be opposed and stopped as the impact of this is far greater than the commercial gain of a company.

attributes.action: Employers to give mothers returning from maternity leave flexible working hours.
attributes.background: This is an issue that many mothers have wrongly encountered. We as mothers should be given the right to have flexible working hours that balance our home and work life. We should not be discriminated for having children.
attributes.additional_details: Applying for flexible working hours to be abolished. Mothers should be offered flexible hours in their current position or offered in same grade position elsewhere. If this is not feasible, lower grade flexible working position.

attributes.action: Review funding into public services. Local authorities, NHS,police etc need help
attributes.background: Working in the public sector I have seen a decline in the last few years and knowing what future budgets hold I fear for communities. Had funding been correct over the years then there wouldn't be issues such as complaints on GP access or lack of bin collections etc
attributes.additional_details:
The evidence here is qualitative:
We all know someone who:

* Has struggled to see a doctor 
* Is homeless or can't get housing 
* Parents who scramble each year for a decent school place
* who is struggling to afford to eat
* works too many hours because they can't afford childcare 
* damaged a tyre due to pot holes in roads 
* Lack of landscaping 
* crime not responded too

attributes.action: Create an age and licence type restriction for drivers of more powerful cars
attributes.background: Young bikers are restricted as to how powerful a bike they can ride based on their age & licence type, yet car drivers can drive any car at any age once they've passed a manual test. This leaves fast cars in the hands of people who aren't competent to drive them, and is also unfair to bikers.
attributes.additional_details: Government statistics from 2011 show that 22% of road fatalities in that year involved drivers aged 17-24. A motorcycle-style age and licence grading system needs to be enforced to reduce these figures.

attributes.action: Update the infrastructure for Army families in Woolwich
attributes.background: The soldiers & their families in Woolwich living in Service Family Accommodation don't enjoy Fibre Broadband despite surrounding areas being connected. Internet is used to stay in touch with loved ones (deployed) and it's a disgrace that for economic reasons infrastructure is left outdated.
attributes.additional_details: All parties in relation to the issue have been contacted with no result so far in 2 years. BT and Virgin cannot make a business case and the MoD told us residents need to self-fund fibre. Self funding however is not an option for a large portion of soldier families being attached to The Vikings, who re-locate every 5 years! The council has no jurisdiction. We've been left to struggle with inconceivably slow broadband surrounded by private housing with fibre access, in a London suburb in zone 4.

attributes.action: Make Marcus Jones review his choice to turn down the funding for mk homeless
attributes.background: Over the last year we have had three of our homeless die on the streets.. There are also people living in  Substandard temporary accommodation in and out of the city. Please review your decision to turn down funding that would of helped these people the government have forgotten
attributes.additional_details:
We have over 500 family's that are homeless... This money would of helped the local authority to provide 50 units to help home these people the gvmt have forgotten... 
People are dying on our streets.. 
Marcus Jones please fully review your decision. 
And give us an answer as to why you turned down the application! 

Thank you

attributes.action: Pass a law that does what the Children & Young Persons Act 1933 is meant to do.
attributes.background: The Children & Young Persons Act 1933 says it is illegal for a child who is younger than 13, to assist in a non-performance trade or occupation carried on for profit. In many cases such as in research this law is not enforced. Therefore a fully enforceable law is needed.
attributes.additional_details: Hundreds of thousands of children younger than 13 are employed in the UK in commercial research, testing, marketing and consultancy (ISBN1845298802). Child Employment Officers do not give them the protection they give children in performance work such as modelling & acting. Irrespective of the above Act the Officers do not regard them as being employed (NNCEE). This, and the lack of protection, undermines their rights as workers, and can result in them being mistreated & deprived of pay (ACAS).

attributes.action: Ban the use of loud fireworks in residential areas
attributes.background: Many animals find fireworks scary. It is estimated that 45 per cent of dogs and other animals in the UK show signs of fear when they hear fireworks (RSPCA). This can include toileting indoors, shaking, barking and crying. Fireworks should not be used in a residential area to avoid animal distress.
attributes.additional_details: Fireworks should not be allowed in residential areas, and should only be allowed in a licensed settings on set days, not days or weeks before/after the event.

attributes.action: 1p and 2p coins should be removed from circulation (cash transactions only)
attributes.background:
We the undersigned want to see the 1p and 2p pieces removed from circulation, since they are no longer of a useful value.

Over time, due to inflation, the value of a coin decreases. The one and two penny pieces are now worth so little that we cannot buy anything useful with them.
attributes.additional_details:
It is important to clarify that this petition is not asking for ALL transactions to be rounded to the nearest 5p. This petition only applies to cash. It calls for removal of 1p and 2p coins, therefore any cash transaction would result in change given rounded to the nearest 5p.

Examples
- If I were to use cash to buy a bottle of milk costing 99p, I would receive no change, since 1p rounds down to zero.

- If I were to buy a cake costing 96p, I would receive 5p change, because 4p rounds up to 5p.

attributes.action: Change Religious Education to Religious and Cultural Studies
attributes.background: Students should be taught more than just basic religious principles. Teaching children about other races and cultures will help stamp out racism in our ever-progressing and diverse society.
attributes.additional_details: Some of the biggest cities in the UK (London, Manchester, Birmingham, Bristol and Cardiff) are among the most diverse in Europe. Our youth should be accepting of their peers whatever their heritage, especially in the wake of Brexit and the rising level of hate crime.

attributes.action: Let voters (Eng, Wal, NI) decide if they want Scotland to remain in Britain.
attributes.background: The Scottish had their say on whether they wanted to remain in Britain or not, but the rest of Britain didn't. No one has taken into consideration what the rest of Britain would like to see and it would only be fair for everyone to have an equal say in the out come from both sides. Let us vote!

attributes.action:
Petition
Allow farmers to grow hemp without restriction.
attributes.background: Remove all restrictions on growing industrial hemp. Although the industrial strains of the plant have no psychoactive potential, the absurd level of control has effectively destroyed its value as an agricultural crop. The fibres , the oils , plastics- endless possibilities all natural
attributes.additional_details: Bees on the endangered species list - kind of important due to pollination - bees love hemp..

attributes.action: Bring back the paper tax disc.
attributes.background: Bring back the paper tax disc, as you can view the tax disc on your screen and can be seen, that you have a tax disc and have the tax, as people are not paying the tax, as well all the tax should go towards the up keep of the road only and not to be used with other tax.
attributes.additional_details: The DVLA hasn't done enough to tell people when they need to pay. When your tax is due, you get a reminder letter, but this is not enough for thousands of people, who forget their renewal date, and can face a fine of up to £1,000.

attributes.action: Create a specialist police unit to deal with modern day slavery.
attributes.background: Modern day slavery is a big issue in the UK with the amount of people referred to the National Referral Mechanism up. I believe that the UK Government should create a national modern slavery unit to crack down on modern day slave owners and the human traffickers that get them into the country.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government's Modern Slavery Strategy:
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/383764/Modern_Slavery_Strategy_FINAL_DEC2015.pdf

The National Crime Agency's statistics on Slavery:
http://www.nationalcrimeagency.gov.uk/publications/national-referral-mechanism-statistics

attributes.action: Stop Corby Urgent Care Centre (8-8) Closure
attributes.background:
Corby Urgent Care Centre (8-8) is said to be closing.

This will cause disruption not to only the community but other health services also! 

Please sign!  DON'T CLOSE OUR 8-8 service!

attributes.action: Make Companies Responsible For Travel Costs After Public Transport Has Stopped.
attributes.background: Members of staff in many companies and businesses spend a large amount of their wages on travel home after hours, businesses and companies should take responsibilty for travel costs for their employees after hours (and on bank holiday's, opens, weekends etc.)
attributes.additional_details: Companies and businesses do not take into consideration the struggle of students, open/close staff, members of staff who live a far distance from work etc. And should been forced to pay travel costs.

attributes.action: Stop mothers trying to stop fathers from seeing their kids
attributes.background: We request the Government to amend the Children Act 1989 and bring in the Presumption of Shared Residence as was originally recommended and intended for the Children Act 1989

attributes.action: Update the border with Scotland based on the popular vote at constituency level.
attributes.background: The border with Scotland has moved north and south over the centuries, but since the Act of Union of 1707 in it has been largely arbitrary. Indeed Berwick on Tweed has passed over the border on a number of occasions.
attributes.additional_details: It seems over recent months and years there has been a surge in Scottish pride and the true border between England and Scotland (where the majority of the residence identify as Scottish) may have shifted to the south. There should be a referendum in each constituency of England (and Wales) to ascertain whether the majority of the residents identify as Scottish.

attributes.action: Allow any region of Scotland voting against independence to remain in UK
attributes.background: Nicola Sturgeon has confirmed she will ask permission for another Scottish independence referendum. This petition is to ensure any region voting against independence (e.g. Shetland, Highlands, Grampian) will remain a part of the UK if an independence vote would drag them out against their will.

attributes.action: It's time to force Yodel, Hermes and all other rogue couriers to be regulated
attributes.background: There is currently no official regulatory body in place to hold courier companies accountable for their infamously poor standards of delivery and customer service. More stringent regulations would ensure that they must meet these basic standards and allow complaints to be formally investigated.
attributes.additional_details: Yodel and Hermes, to name just two of these companies, have already been much publicised for their poor reputation. For reference see BBC's Watchdog, or the current Twitter feed of @yodelonline. Time and time again these companies fall back on their tightly worded contractual Ts & Cs ensuring that their errors are not held accountable for. These companies exist to undercut the market at the cost of the buyer and it is high time that they are held to task.

attributes.action: HS2 should be scrapped and funds diverted to improving the UK Road Network
attributes.background: HS2 has a limited impact on the UK population vs the benefits of improving both the quality of road surfaces in the UK and the Road Network infrastructure.
attributes.additional_details: The state of local authority controlled roads and the national road network have been side lined for too long. Any national infrastructure transportation funding should be directed at the road network before any investment in the HS2 rail project.

attributes.action: REMOVE  all restrictions from the £100,000 Transferable Main Residence Tax(RNRB)
attributes.background:
The RNRB, an addition to the IHT allowance, states this property allowance is only exempt from IHT if the property is bequeathed to a direct descendant of the deceased, or their spouse/civil partner.
For RNRB purposes common law partners or relatives such as nephews,nieces,siblings are exempt.
attributes.additional_details:
INSTEAD give the allowance restriction free, to all property owners,  enabling them to bequeath as much of their main residence free from IHT as possible.
This would increase the  current £325,000 IHT threshold by £100,000. Increasing to £500,000 by 2020.This then can be bequeathed to anybody you choose
See https://www.gov.uk/wills-probate-inheritance/overview. Select IHT go to item 2,

attributes.action: To be able to claim carers allowance per person that you care for
attributes.background: Iam a mother of two children who both receive middle rate DLA for there disability Primary Ciliary Dyskinesia. Currently as the system works you can only claim carers allowance for 1 child / adult , even through when caring for two is double the work load and time spent.

attributes.action: Enforce the law that makes placing tart cards in public telephones illegal.
attributes.background: Tart cards are the cards that advertise prostitution services, which are often found in public telephones. The placing of these advertisements was made illegal by the Criminal Justice and Police Act of 2001, in Section 46. However, it seems as if nothing is being done to enforce this law.
attributes.additional_details: Every day on many public telephones the sexually explicit pictures can be found in abundance. Numerous studies have revealed how looking at such images damages the brain. It is not acceptable that our children and youth are exposed to these images in public places and that the perpetrators are not brought to justice. It is a primary duty of government to protect its citizens, and that includes protecting children from explicit images in public places. This law must be enforced with more vigour.

attributes.action: Cap graduation fees for university students.
attributes.background:
University graduation costs have become too expensive. Many universities charge  between £20 to £40 a ticket for each family member. This is not accessible to those who are on lower incomes in any way.

Cap what they can charge, and make this more accessible to all students and their families.

attributes.action: Do urgent studies into Cannabis Oil for cures for Cancer,back pain other illness
attributes.background: Last year I was taking 8 morphine tablets a day, I starting using Cannabis Oil, NOT NOW, when I was taking it, my pain managment went to 1 tablet at night. My dear friend now has cancer and this could cure her and millions more with many illnesses. Please do an INDEPENDENT REPORT on Cannabis Oil.

attributes.action: HMO to be soundproofed.
attributes.background: Our lives are a living hell because of HMO property next door ,Legislation is required so families like ours can live in peace .
attributes.additional_details: We have endured countless sleepless nights due to the property next door whilst we have nothing against students we now feel our lives are a living hell .this affected our health and well being ,having brought up our family here it is heartbreaking that we are going to have to sell as we can not live like this any longer ,the landlords need to be accountable and responsible for their property,allowing  neighbours to live in peace.

attributes.action: Urge the government to extend Help to Buy to include old properties.
attributes.background: The Government has dragged it's heels dealing with the housing crisis in London so as a result we need to urge them to do more regarding affordable housing. One of the things the government can and should do is extend the Help to Buy scheme to include older properties.
attributes.additional_details: The help to buy scheme could be really useful if it were extended to include older properties. The government should also charge a percentage identical to the bank of England base rate after the 5yr free period. If the UK government is serious about helping Londoners get on the ladder they should revise the Help to Buy scheme immediately to include older properties as house builders have pushed up the cost of new builds at an alarming rate. Not everyone wants a new build.

attributes.action: Make it law for school to start at 10am and finish later.
attributes.background: There have been many studies that suggest school starts too early for teenagers brains to function properly. If we started later not as many people would be late and would increase productivity.
attributes.additional_details: Many different studies suggest this.

attributes.action: Stop HGV vehicles using the third lane on four lane motorway sections.
attributes.background: Stop sections of motorways slowing to a crawl and causing long tail backs across three lanes.
attributes.additional_details: When HGV  vehicles block three lanes it cause other drivers to drive erratically to get past.

attributes.action: Government to introduce clause to declassify first class on trains at peak times
attributes.background: During peak / commuter hours, many trains are running at capacity except for the first class areas, which are often empty. This is forcing people to stand when they could be sitting in comfort and therefore having a more enjoyable commute to work.
attributes.additional_details: As the government is responsible for issuing the franchises to companies to run trains on the railways, I am calling for a clause to be added at the time of renewals for first class to be de classified during peak hours or on commuter trains. Unlike the intercity trains, there are no real benefits from having first class (i.e no refreshment service) and the seats are often no different. These seats could be used by more people and offer value for money when prices are  increasing annually.

attributes.action: Allow the Church of England to legally perform gay marriages
attributes.background: The Government's Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Bill was on 17th July 2013. However, The Act does not allow the Church of England to perform same sex marriages. If the church is willing to perform them or not should not matter, the law should not prevent the church from doing them.
attributes.additional_details:
The legislation to create same - sex marriage was explicitly drafted so that no church or church minister can be compelled " by any means " to carry out same - sex wedding. The Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Act contains the Government's ' quad lock ', a set of four safeguards for churches and ministers who disagree with same sex marriage. The fourth safeguard states that the Church of England cannot opt in under the terms of the 
2013 Act.

attributes.action: Delay Article 50 until the policy of the US towards Russia and NATO is clearer
attributes.background: A strong European Union is essential if stronger ties between the US and Russia are formed and US support for NATO is reduced. Triggering Article 50 before US policy becomes clear could be highly detrimental to the stability of all European countries including the UK.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2017/feb/09/brexit-trump-britain-national-security-article-50

attributes.action: Give early years teachers (with EYTS) the same rights for pay as those with QTS.
attributes.background: EYTs have to pass the same skills test and interviews to qualify onto the course, and meet and pass against the same amount of standards and assessments as those with QTS. Therefore rights for starting pay should be the same, and the professionalism of the early years should be further recognised.
attributes.additional_details: Get into teaching (https://getintoteaching.education.gov.uk/funding-and-salary/teacher-salaries) states 'As a newly qualified teacher you’ll begin on a salary of at least £22,467, or £28,098 in inner London. As you rise up the pay ranges, you could earn as much as £115,582 as a head...' However on the same web page it states an unqualified teacher can receive a minimum of £16,461. Early Years Teachers are currently viewed as 'unqualified' despite the vigorous post graduate year training.

attributes.action: Reform the law to secure greater equality for transgender and non-binary people
attributes.background:
Trans and non-binary people face inequality in the law and unacceptable levels of discrimination in society. 

The UK government must reform the law to extend discrimination protections, improve gender recognition rights, and give the Scottish Parliament powers to protect & extend LGBTI equality.
attributes.additional_details:
Specifically this petition calls on the UK government to:
 
• Update the Equality Act 2010 to ensure all trans and non-binary people are fully protected from discrimination.
 
• Reform the Gender Recognition Act 2004 in line with international best practice, and scrap the spousal veto, to ensure all trans and non-binary people are able to access their human right to legal gender recognition.
 
• Devolve equality law to Scotland so the Scottish Parliament can protect and extend LGBTI equality.

attributes.action: Parliament to debate scrapping Trident in order to fund care for the elderly.
attributes.background: Instead of paying £40bn for a white elephant that serves no purpose other than for illusory political prestige, we can fuund care of the elderly as it becomes an increasing burden on the NHS and Local Authorities, saving the need to increase taxation
attributes.additional_details: None needed - public domain

attributes.action: Ban Employment Agencies
attributes.background:
Employment Agencies exploit workers by acting as middle men to real jobs, they take cuts from already terrible wages, and have ruined chances for secure employment for British Nationals.

This drives down the UK living standards, work life balance, and makes it tougher to get real employment.
attributes.additional_details:
Companies that employ staff also exploit Employment Agencies as they pay agencies less money than they would pay their staff to get work done. Companies don't have to employ agency workers as staff, even when the workers do a fantastic job.

Some agency workers even come from different countries, and are happy to work for pittance as their foreign value of money is less than ours in the UK.

This is extremely unfair and unethical for for British Nationals in their own country.

attributes.action: Charge for GP apptments. Allow GP's to dispense low cost drugs such as aspirin.
attributes.background:
A small charge for visit to GP would deter time wasters & release funds for deserving needs. 
GP's prescribe aspirin and similar drugs costing a few pence which incur standard £10-£12 "Pharmacy handling" charge to the Dept of Health. Curb this waste too and spend on more deserving needs
attributes.additional_details:
From data in the public domain it is evident that many patients fail to attend appointments with virtually no financial penalty. A £5-£10 per person per appointment (with some exceptions) is affordable by the majority of inhabitants.
Prescriptions for low cost (normally over the counter) drugs incur significant "handling" charge. By permitting/instructing GP's to dispense such items the savings can be diverted/used to benefit more urgent demands on the Health Service.

attributes.action: Right tostrike in essential services replaced by referralto adjudication service
attributes.background: For too long commuters/patients/the public have been the victims of protracted disputes between the unions of essential service providers and local/central government employers. Strikes are a primitive/inefficient way of resolving disputes and should be replaced by a binding adjudication service
